title: Caroline Flack to host controversial series where players pitch plastic surgery
text:
Caroline Flack has confirmed she will be hosting The Surjury – a controversial new series where people pitch their plastic surgery dreams to a jury of people.

Love Island’s leading lady posted a photo from the set of the new series on Instagram, with a simple: ‘Over the Mooooooon to be hosting my first @channel4 show ❤️ #thesurjury.’

Each episode will see young hopefuls wanting plastic surgery procedures but are unable to afford it pitch their desires to a group of strangers.

If 75% of the jury approve at the end of their pitch, they will get their dream body, and will undergo the operations.

Plans for the series was announced at the beginning of the year, with Channel 4 stating: ‘From bum-lifts to nose jobs, sculpted abs to breast enlargements, The Surjury allows people to explore their choices more thoroughly.’

Ross McCarthy, executive producer for show creators Gobstopper Television, added: ‘This is a totally new way of doing peer-to- peer advice.

‘Our pitchers will either get the surgery they’ve always wanted, or a massive boost in confidence when the public rules they don’t need work at all!’

The star is hoping to transform lives on the controversial series (Picture: ITV/REX)

However, it came fiercely under fire for its format, claiming it was glorifying plastic surgery and will ‘trivialise life-changing decisions’ as series.

‘Rather than wag a disapproving finger, this new series looks at who wants it, and why – and allows those who make a strong enough case to their peers, to undergo the procedure of their choice,’ a Channel 4 rep said.

‘The show will neither glamorise nor condemn their choices: the aim is instead to interrogate the realities.

‘All contributors featured in the series have actively been seeking surgery of their own accord.’

The Surjury airs in 2020 on Channel 4.
